intro: Psychotria greenwelliae, commonly known as the Greenwell's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
